description: ven- +â€Ž puncture, equivalent to veno- + puncture but with -i- as interconsonantal (versus -o-)

entries.meaning: (hematology) The puncture of a vein, usually to draw a blood sample, collect a blood donation, or insert an intravenous line.

verbs.description: venipuncture (third-person singular simple present venipunctures, present participle venipuncturing, simple past and past participle venipunctured)

entries.meaning: To puncture a vein in order to collect blood; to perform venipuncture.
